<!-- This is an R markdown file that uses knitr to compile the pdf. Most of the code below uses Latex to control "floats" (basically how it lays out figures). The line "\FloatBarrier" after every section, forces the figures/floats to print, so they don't end up at the end of the document. -->

<!-- Numbering Commands -->
\renewcommand{\thetable}{S\arabic{table}}
\renewcommand{\thefigure}{S\arabic{figure}}

<!-- Header Commands -->
\pagestyle{fancy}
\fancyhead[LE,RO]{}
\fancyhead[LO,RE]{}
\renewcommand{\headrulewidth}{.5pt}
\renewcommand{\footrulewidth}{0pt}

<!-- Define the path for figures -->
\graphicspath{ {../../diagnostic-output/paper-figures/Supplement/} }

<!-- Add a list of figures -->
\newpage
\renewcommand*\listfigurename{List of Tables and Figures}
\cftsetindents{figure}{0em}{2 em}

<!-- Add list of figures with the word "Figure" before label. instead of  \listoffigures -->
\let\oldnumberline\numberline
\renewcommand{\numberline}{\figurename~\oldnumberline}
\listoffigures

\FloatBarrier

\section{H. Comparisons to Other Inventories}
\fancyhead[RO,RE]{H. Comparisons to Other Inventories}
\addcontentsline{lof}{section}{H. Comparisons to Other Inventories}

\begin{figure}[!ht]
  \centering
  \includegraphics[width=6.5in]{Paper_Figure_other_inventories.pdf}
  \caption{Like with like comparison of global CEDS emissions with EDGAR, GAINS, CMIP5, and CDIAC (for CO2 only)}
\end{figure}

\begin{figure}[!ht]
  \centering
  \includegraphics[width=6.5in]{CMIP5_Region_Comparison.pdf}
  \caption{CEDS versus CMIP5: Top 5 emitting regions (CMIP 5 definitions) compared to comprable CEDS regions. Like with like comparison of regional emissions of top emitters. These figures do not include open burning (grassland or forest fires), fossil-fuel fires, agricultural waste burning on fields, or aviation. "China+" includes China, Hong Kong, Macau, Mongolia, and Chinese Taipei. "Russia+" includes Russia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia. "Western Africa" includes Benin, Burkina Faso, Central African Republic, Cote d'Ivoire, Cameroon, DR Congo, Congo, Cape Verde, Gabon, Ghana, Guinea, Gambia, Guinea-Bissau, Equatorial Guinea, Liberia, Mali, Mauretania, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, St Helena, Sierra Leone, Sao Tome and Principe, Chad, and Togo}
\end{figure}

\begin{figure}[!ht]
  \centering
  \includegraphics[width=6.5in]{CMIP5_Sector_Comparison.pdf}
  \caption{CEDS versus CMIP5: Like with like comparison of global emissions by aggregate sector. These figures do not include open burning (grassland or forest fires), fossil-fuel fires, agricultural waste burning on fields, or aviation.}
\end{figure}
